page.title: 04CEREAL GROWING IN N-E LEICS.
page.content: The main crops grown for cash on mixed farms here are wheat and barley with a small amount of oats. These are{sown mainly in autumn and{harvested}in July and August.They must be{sprayed against pests and diseases once or twice annually and the land fertilised They are harvested either by the farmer himself, if he owns a{combine or the harvesting may be contracted out.The stacking of{straw bales}left after harvest is a time-consuming and heavy task carried out by all the farmers family who are able. However this job is being increasingly mechanised.This straw is used as feed and litter for the livestock or some times it is sold.Some farmers have {mechanised grain handling facilities and are able to store the grain until the market price is right.{Drying {facilities}are necessary in wet years.
